message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the physical appearance of an underfed animal. When an animal, like a lion, has bones protruding from underneath its fur, it is a sign that it has not been receiving enough food or nutrients. This is characteristic of being underfed. Option (A) is unrelated and does not provide any information about the lion's condition. Option (B) is incorrect because overfeeding would result in an overweight lion, not one with bones protruding. Option (C) is unrelated and does not provide any information about the lion's condition.

Option (C) is unrelated and does not provide any information about the lion's condition.
